image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Washington; born Jolene Bishoprick in Corvallis, Benton County, Oreg., December 3, 1931; attended primary schools in Shanghai, China, 1938-1940, and public schools in Portland, Oreg., and Vancouver, Wash.; attended Oregon State University, Corvallis, 1949-1951; resident of Kathmandu, Nepal, 1962-1967; director, English Language Institute, Kathmandu, 1965-1967; independent citizen lobbyist, consultant, and lecturer, 1971-1984; member, Democratic National Committee, 1980-1988; Washington State representative, 1985-1988; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1989-January 3, 1995); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourth Congress; died on November 28, 2021, in Olympia, Wash.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Jolene Unsoeld" in Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & Preservation, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2006.

researchRecord.name: 1990, 5 commercials on 3 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials used during Jolene Unsoeld's campaign for the 1990 U.S. congressional election in District 3 of Washington, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: ca. 1971-1988, 82 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The collection contains pre-congressional papers, documenting Jolene Unsoeld's service as a lobbyist, her Congressional service, and Democratic Party activities. The collection is currently unprocessed but a preliminary inventory is available: http://archives.evergreen.edu/SpecialCollections/HomeUnsoeldJ.htm. .

researchRecord.name: In the Curt Pavola Papers, 1980-2000, 10.5 linear feet.
